resources.string: Come to the wonderful Anaheim ICE to show your stuff on the ice! This is a once in a lifetime opportunity! (Not really xD)
Come to Camelot Golfland and race for the longest time at mini golf! This is a previous Madasen-favorite!
Feeling stressed out from a long week studying political science? Walk around the Orange Circle and you never know just what you might find!
Classic date idea, but fun nonetheless! Showtimes are on Google!
Partake in this professional sport of rolling a big ball at a bunch of sticks! \n\nIt\'s fun!
The Ronald Raegan Presidential Library may be an hour and a half away, but worth the drive! Order tickets online.
This one is simple and more fun than you might expect. Bring a blanket out on a night hike and see the stars together!
Buy a disposable camera for less than $10 and don\'t stop hiking until you fill up the camera with pictures!
This one is simple. $10 each, walk around a flea market together and see who can buy the coolest present for the other person!
Find a two-person kayak at Southwind Kayaks! $40 for two hours in a two-person kayak and paddle around Newport Beach to your heart\'s content!
Here are the rules: Find somewhere to eat without using Maps which is at least 30 minutes away. Make it fun, try somewhere new!
Newport, Huntington, Laguna, Corona Del Mar…I could go on.
Surprisingly cheap, this cruise takes you from Newport Beach on a magical ride to see some of nature\'s most magestic creatures…2.5 hours, too!
I don\'t know if there are still any going on, but if there are, look it up!
At your service. I shall be your waiter and chef for the evening. What would you like to eat? \n\n(Within reason, please)
I wasn\'t sure what kind of musical/play/opera/whatever you\'d be interested in.
There\'s nothing better for blowing off steam than watching someone pour their heart out on stage.
Alright, I know this one is a little more involved. But I found a place where we could get a few ballroom dance lessons for cheap!
Okay. So we write insulting poetry in a funny way, find a bar/coffee shop that hosts slam poetry, and go show our stuff! Or..we could also just go watch other people.
I know you didn\'t like the improv that Chapman put on, but maybe at a more professional place it could be fun!
You know how Jim Miller is six stories high? You know how to make a paper airplanes? \n\n\'Nuff said.
Head over to Newport Beach for a fun time paddle boarding your legs off! I know it\'s intimidating, but it looks like fun! Head to Southwind Kayaks.
There are plenty of board game options in the Morlan lounge! Scrabble included!
You have a pool. Chapman has a pool. We can figure something out and invite a bunch of our friends!
I don\'t know the area super well..But my idea was just to find a church or nonprofit that accepts volunteers? Or go to a soup kitchen? What do you think?
If you wanna write a song, let\'s write a song. If you wanna play random covers of songs we like, let\'s do that! Or...we could go out to a street corner :)
Find a good book (or a textbook) and let\'s just hang out and read in a coffee shop somewhere!
If you\'ve just got too much work, and need to be productive, I\'m sure I can find something to do. Coffee shops work, library rooms work. Or Somo 121 :)
Okay, okay. This one is a little more involved. But ask Tommy for your first hint.
